title.rendered: From Failed Plugins to 800K+ Users: How Sagar Patel Quietly Built a WordPress Empire

content.rendered:
This week, Manan Shah and I had the privilege of sitting down with Sagar Patel,

A humble visionary who turned a $7 freelancing gig into a thriving WordPress powerhouse.

In a small village near Ahmedabad, a boy without a computer dreamed of building tools that would power websites around the world.

His parents never finished school. He saved lunch money to browse the internet from cyber caf√©s. His first online profit? $7.

Today, that dreamer is none other than the founder of Posimyth Innovations, Sagar Patel.

This is the story of how humble beginnings, curiosity, and quiet conviction built something remarkable.

From Village Life to the Digital World

Sagar was born in Naroda, a village near Ahmedabad. His father was a milkman and farmer. His parents never completed schooling.

Despite limited resources, Sagar‚Äôs natural curiosity and love for philosophy shaped his early thinking. He excelled in school but saw his college grades dip, Not from lack of effort, but from exploring beyond the classroom.

He studied Computer Science (B.E.) at Gujarat Technological University (2010‚Äì2013), and didn‚Äôt own a personal computer until his third year. Instead, he relied on cyber caf√©s and his college library to chase his fascination with the digital world.

‚ÄúWhen you‚Äôre hungry to learn, you find a way. No matter where you are.‚Äù

The $7 That Started It All

In his 7th semester, Sagar began freelancing, doing small projects late at night. Along with his friend Rushi Patel, he co-founded INSIGNIA Technolabs in 2013.

He spent nights sending proposals on platforms like Upwork and Freelancer.com

His first earnings? $7. Not just a number, A turning point.

Discovering the Problem in WordPress

As he built websites, Sagar encountered WordPress and saw both its promise and its pain:

  • Performance issues
  • Limited design flexibility
  • Friction for non-technical users
  • Bloated tools that made simple tasks harder

Most plugins didn‚Äôt solve real problems. They added noise, not clarity.

This insight sparked something deeper, A vision to build what creators truly needed.

Launching Posimyth, On a Date That Meant More

On 20th July 2015, the anniversary of humankind‚Äôs first step on the moon, Sagar launched Posimyth Innovations.

His mission was clear:

‚ÄúEmpower creators to build better websites without struggling with complex tools.‚Äù

The first product? The Plus Addons for Elementor, A performance-first, user-friendly toolkit that extended Elementor‚Äôs potential in powerful new ways.

Building With Users in Mind

Instead of competing on features, Sagar focused on:

  • Solving real problems
  • Clean design systems
  • Performance optimization
  • Thoughtful onboarding
  • Human support and documentation

The result? A growing suite of products loved by creators across the world:

  • The Plus Addons for Elementor
  • The Plus Blocks for Gutenberg
  • Nexter WordPress Theme
  • A suite of upcoming AI-powered tools

With over 30,000 active installs, Posimyth Innovations is now a trusted name in the WordPress creator economy.

Lessons from the Journey

Sagar credits his growth to continuous learning, Through YouTube, podcasts, reading, and networking.

But more than knowledge, it‚Äôs his mindset that stands out.

‚ÄúIf you’re truly committed and passionate, you can achieve anything.‚Äù


‚ÄúFocus on solving real problems, Not just building cool features.‚Äù


‚ÄúClear documentation and helpful onboarding matter as much as code.‚Äù

Final Word: What We Can Learn

From a tiny village in Gujarat to building products used by 30,000+ global users, Sagar‚Äôs story isn‚Äôt about flashy headlines. It‚Äôs about quiet consistency and deep clarity.

He didn‚Äôt have the best tools – he built them.
He didn‚Äôt follow hype – he followed purpose.

In doing so, he didn‚Äôt just build plugins.
He built confidence, trust, and a better way to create.

title.rendered: How Mehul Built a ‚Çπ22 Cr/year Company After Dropping Out of College

content.rendered:
This Week, I had the privilege of catching up with Mr. Mehul, founder of Say Solar.

What began as a casual coffee conversation turned into something far deeper ‚Äî a story not just about building a business, but about transforming a mindset, overcoming odds, and choosing purpose over shortcuts.

The Backbencher No One Expected

Let me take you back to college days.

Mehul was never the ‚Äúmodel student.‚Äù

  • A backbencher by choice.
  • Low scores and barely scraping by in exams.
  • He was detained in Semester 3.

To most people, that would have written him off. Nobody‚Äînot even professors or peers‚Äîimagined he‚Äôd one day lead a multi-crore business that‚Äôs shaping the future of renewable energy in Gujarat.

But behind those quiet classrooms sat a young man with fire in his gut.

A fire to do something meaningful. To build something that mattered.

Betting on Solar, Not on Shortcuts

After college, while others rushed to land stable jobs, Mehul made a choice that changed everything.

He saw the rising need ‚Äî and broken trust ‚Äî in India‚Äôs solar energy market. Especially in Gujarat, a state blessed with sunlight but underserved by reliable solutions.

And so, with no funding, no big brand name, and no safety net, Mehul started Say Solar ‚Äî a venture rooted in trust, transparency, and technology.

His goal?
To make solar energy accessible and trustworthy for every household.

Not just installations. But education, service, and long-term support.

Numbers That Tell a Deeper Story

Fast forward to 2025, and Say Solar isn‚Äôt just growing ‚Äî it‚Äôs thriving.

  • 5000+ solar rooftop installations across Gujarat
  • ‚Çπ22 Crore turnover in FY 2024‚Äì25
  • Fully automated CRM & operations with Zoho
  • A scalable dealer network expanding rapidly
  • Bold mission: Solarizing 1,00,000 homes by 2030

These numbers are impressive, but what stands out more is the philosophy Mehul operates with.

He doesn‚Äôt talk like a salesperson.
He speaks like a system builder, an educator, a visionary who knows the impact of every solar panel he installs.

The Mindset Shift: From Marks to Mission

The most inspiring part?

Mehul never blames his past.
Never hides his low scores.
Never denies the tough start.

Instead, he embraces it because it shaped him.
His story is a living example of something we all need to hear more often:

“Your marks don‚Äôt define your mindset.
Your failures don‚Äôt define your future.”

We‚Äôre conditioned to believe success comes to toppers, those who tick every box.
But Mehul proves it‚Äôs effort, resilience, and systems thinking that win the long game.

Final Thoughts: A Gujarati Entrepreneur Who‚Äôs Leading with Grit

As someone who‚Äôs known Mehul from the ‚Äúbackbencher days,‚Äù I couldn‚Äôt be more proud.

He represents a new kind of founder ‚Äî not chasing vanity metrics, not flashing investor decks, but building quietly and boldly, with purpose at the center.

And if there‚Äôs one thing to take away from his journey, it‚Äôs this:

Being average on paper means nothing
when you’re extraordinary in effort.

Here‚Äôs to more stories like this ‚Äî of real founders, real impact, and the quiet revolutions happening in small towns and sunny rooftops across India.

The Backbencher No One Expected Let […]

title.rendered: Founder Stories: A Fearless Vision with Harshal Trivedi, Founder of Tusker AI

content.rendered:
This week, Manan Shah and I had the privilege of sitting down with someone I‚Äôve admired for over 15 years ‚Äî Harshal Trivedi, the visionary founder of Tusker AI and the driving force behind Softvan Pvt. Ltd., now part of the Sahana System Group.

What began as a casual coffee conversation turned into a deep dive into tech, mindset, research, and leadership ‚Äî essentially, a masterclass in fearless entrepreneurship.

About the Founder: A Rare Blend of Vision and Discipline

Harshal Sir is far from your typical tech founder.

While most struggle to balance one venture, he:

  • Leads a 150+ member software agency, Softvan Pvt. Ltd.
  • Built Tusker AI, a powerful no-code computer vision platform
  • Is currently pursuing a PhD at Nirma University ‚Äî yes, you read that right.

This mix of execution, education, and evolution is rare ‚Äî and exactly what made this conversation unforgettable.

What We Discussed: Learnings from a Deep-Tech Trailblazer

1. Executing a Startup Idea the Right Way

Harshal emphasized that launching a tech product is not just about building, but about:

  • Validating your idea through surveys and feedback
  • Selecting the right tech stack with scalability in mind
  • Always anchoring innovation in real-world problems

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt start with code. Start with clarity.‚Äù

2. The Mindset of Rapid Tech Adoption

Tusker AI thrives in a fast-moving ecosystem ‚Äî from computer vision to no-code innovation ‚Äî but Harshal makes it clear:

‚ÄúSpeed isn‚Äôt about being first. It‚Äôs about learning faster than anyone else.‚Äù

He explained how his team constantly experiments, adapts, and delivers, helping global clients with cutting-edge yet stable solutions.

3. The Role of Networking in Mindset Shaping

What sets Harshal apart is not just what he builds, but how he connects:

  • He actively mentors other founders
  • He‚Äôs constantly attending academic and industry events
  • And he believes networking is not for funding ‚Äî it‚Äôs for learning

‚ÄúSurround yourself with people who‚Äôve already walked the path you‚Äôre starting on.‚Äù

4. Thinking Outside the Box

Harshal shared multiple examples of how unconventional thinking led to practical breakthroughs. One that stuck with us:

‚ÄúThe answers to tech problems are rarely in tech ‚Äî they‚Äôre in how people use it.‚Äù

Whether it’s deploying AI in agriculture or healthcare, Tusker AI is built not just for accuracy, but accessibility.

5. Balancing Work & Quality of Life

Despite his jam-packed schedule, he‚Äôs intentional about downtime, family, and personal development. He believes:

‚ÄúA clear mind builds better products.‚Äù

In today‚Äôs hustle culture, this was a refreshing ‚Äî and much-needed ‚Äî reminder.

What Stood Out the Most

I‚Äôve known Harshal Sir for over 15 years. If there‚Äôs one consistent quality in him, it‚Äôs his ability to simplify complex problems using relatable, real-world analogies.

He doesn‚Äôt build for hype. He builds for impact.

His journey ‚Äî from services to SaaS, from founder to PhD scholar ‚Äî shows that learning never stops, and neither does purpose-driven innovation.

Why This Conversation Matters

This wasn‚Äôt just a podcast episode. It was a deep look at how:

  • Ideas are born from observation
  • Execution comes from discipline
  • Growth comes from courage

And most importantly, how staying curious and humble can take you much further than just chasing trends.

Final Thoughts

Founder Stories isn‚Äôt just about documenting success ‚Äî it‚Äôs about learning from journeys like Harshal Sir‚Äôs that break the mold.

If you’re building a startup, dreaming of your own SaaS product, or wondering how to lead with both brain and heart, this conversation is your playbook.

Stay tuned ‚Äî more fearless founders coming soon.

üí° Want to be featured on Founder Stories?
Drop us a message or DM ‚ÄúFounder‚Äù ‚Äî let‚Äôs amplify your story.

title.rendered: Founders Stories: It was supposed to be just another quick meetup.
How GetUnstuck 2025 Sparked an AI Mindshift in Ahmedabad‚Äôs Tech Scene

content.rendered:
Hello,

Hope you’re doing well!

We recently shared a story from our conversation with Harshal Trivedi (Tusker AI), and it reached 12,000+ impressions on LinkedIn, sparking real conversations around tech, product, and fearless entrepreneurship.

Before that, our story on Vishal from Zybra helped them gain 5 new clients from Ahmedabad ‚Äî all because their journey resonated with the right audience.

And here‚Äôs what makes this different ‚Äî
We‚Äôre not commercial, we don‚Äôt charge anything, and we invest our own time to research, write, and share real founder stories. It‚Äôs our passion project ‚Äî a movement to bring out the raw, untold journeys of tech entrepreneurs like you.

A quick intro about us:

üë®‚Äçüíª I‚Äôm Harsh Shah, founder of an IT company working with USA & UK brands for the last 6 years.
üß† My co-founder in this initiative is Manan Shah, Sr. Tech Lead and AI Researcher at Infosys.

We‚Äôd love to feature your story next ‚Äî not as an interview, but as a casual and thoughtful chat.
We‚Äôre curious to know:

  • How your journey started

  • How you‚Äôre using (or planning) AI in your business

  • What mindset has helped you grow

  • And what lessons others can learn from your experience

Let us know if you‚Äôd be open to meeting ‚Äî we‚Äôll work around your schedule.

Warm regards,
Harsh Shah & Manan Shah
Founder Stories
